entry.summary: January 7, 2025 3:30 a.m. Winston Police recently arrested a man after a series of vehicle break-ins. By January 2nd, they identified the suspect as 42-year-old Richard Harris of Roseburg. Officers...

entry.title: CITY OF ROSEBURG LEAF COLLECTION PROGRAM WRAPPING UP
entry.summary: January 7, 2025 3:20 a.m. The City of Roseburg leaf collection program is close to wrapping up. Public Works Director Ryan Herinckx told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that the goal of the program is to give all residences the same level of service, which typically means 3 leaf collections during the program....

entry.title: CITY OF ROSEBURG TAKING APPLICATIONS FOR TWO COMMISSIONS
entry.summary: January 7, 2025 3:05 a.m. The City of Roseburg is taking applications for two commissions. A city release said there is currently a vacancy on the Roseburg Planning Commission and 2 vacancies on the Public Works Commission. The commissions serve in an advisory capacity to the city council. The Planning Commission vacancy and one Public...

entry.title: DEPARTMENT OF REVENUE HAS TIPS TO EASE TAX-FILING STRESS
entry.summary: January 7, 2025 2:50 a.m. The Oregon Department of Revenue has tips to ease tax-filing stress now that the new year is here. Taxpayers should make sure their information, like their username, password and address, is current at Revenue Online, the state’s internet tax portal and verify any estimated tax payments they’ve made. Those who...

entry.title: Tommy Whiteside debuts jazz album "Nana's Piano" at Rosebud Theatre
entry.summary: For drummer and composer Tommy Whiteside, debuting his new original album “Nana’s Piano” at the Rosebud Theatre wasn’t just an opportunity to show off his personal skills as a musician, but the talent of Roseburg’s music scene as a whole.

entry.title: Community health seminar explores diabetes prevention
entry.summary: ROSEBURG – The Roseburg Public Library will host a free seminar, Pathways to Prevention: Staying Ahead of Diabetes, on Wednesday, Jan. 22, from 5:30 to 6:30 p.m.

entry.title: UCC launches first apprenticeship for surgical technologist
entry.summary: WINCHESTER — A partnership of Umpqua Community College and Southwestern Oregon Workforce Investment Board should net Douglas County and Oregon overall more surgical technologists.
